name: taxon
title: Taxon
description: An accepted name with a taxonomic classification given either as a parent-child relation or as a flat, denormalized record.

fields.name: ID
fields.description: Unique taxon identifier that is referred to elsewhere via `taxonID`.

fields.name: sourceID
fields.description: Optional identifier for the source this record came from as listed in the [metadata.yaml](https://github.com/CatalogueOfLife/coldp/blob/master/metadata.yaml)

fields.name: parentID
fields.description: The direct parent taxon's ID in the classification. This is the preferred way of exchanging a hierarchy and takes precedence over any classification given in the denormalized fields.

fields.name: nameID
fields.description: Pointer to the accepted name referring to an existing Name.ID within this data package.

fields.name: namePhrase
fields.description: An optional, unrestricted, lose phrase appended to the name just for this taxon. E.g. the phrase "sensu lato" may be added to the name to describe this taxon more precisely.

fields.name: accordingToID
fields.description: A reference ID to the publication that established the taxonomic concept used by this taxon. The author & year of the reference will be used to qualify the name with `sensu AUTHOR, YEAR`. The ID must refer to an existing Reference.ID within this data package.

fields.name: provisional
fields.description: A flag indicating that the taxon is only provisionally accepted and should be handled with care.

fields.name: scrutinizer
fields.description: Name of the person who is the latest scrutinizer who revised or reviewed the taxonomic concept.

fields.name: scrutinizerID
fields.description: Identifier for the scrutinizer. Highly recommended are [ORCID](https://orcid.org/) ids.

fields.name: scrutinizerDate
fields.description: The [ISO8601 date](https://specs.frictionlessdata.io//table-schema/#date) when the taxonomic concept was last revised or reviewed by the scrutinizer.

fields.name: extinct
fields.description: Nullable flag indicating that the taxon is extinct (true) or extant (false). This includes species that died out very recently.

fields.name: temporalRangeStart
fields.description: Earliest appearance of the taxon in the geological time scale. Recommended values are geochronological names from the official [International Commission on Stratigraphy (ICS)](https://stratigraphy.org/chart) or million years before present, given with the unit `Ma` after the number, e.g. `17.4 Ma.`

fields.name: temporalRangeEnd
fields.description: Latest appearance of the taxon in the geological time scale. Recommended values are geochronological names from the official [International Commission on Stratigraphy (ICS)](https://stratigraphy.org/chart) or million years before present, given with the unit `Ma` after the number, e.g. `17.4 Ma.`

fields.name: environment
fields.description: A comma delimited list of environments this taxon is known to exist in.

fields.name: referenceID
fields.description: A comma concatenated list of reference IDs supporting the taxonomic concept that has been reviewed by the scrutinizer. Each ID must refer to an existing Reference.ID within this data package. See [best practices](https://github.com/CatalogueOfLife/coldp#best-practices) for details on how to concatenate multi values.

fields.name: species
fields.description: The species binomial the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: section
fields.description: The (botanical) section the taxon is classified in. Considered a botanical rank below subgenus, not a zoological above family. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: subgenus
fields.description: The subgenus the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: genus
fields.description: The genus the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: subtribe
fields.description: The subtribe the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: tribe
fields.description: The tribe the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: subfamily
fields.description: The subfamily the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: family
fields.description: The family the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: superfamily
fields.description: The superfamily the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: suborder
fields.description: The suborder the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: order
fields.description: The order the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: subclass
fields.description: The subclass the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: class
fields.description: The class the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: subphylum
fields.description: The subphylum the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: phylum
fields.description: The phylum the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.description: The kingdom the taxon is classified in. If parentID is given this field is ignored.

fields.name: sequenceIndex
fields.description: A integer to specify an optional custom sort order for sibling taxa sharing the same parentID in the datasets. This can be used to define a traditional ordering of orders and families for example and can be existing for parts of the dataset, e.g. higher ranks, only. The natural ordering of integers from small to large should be applied. Not that this does not have to be a unique, global index.

fields.name: link
fields.description: A link to a webpage provided by the source depicting the taxon.

fields.name: remarks
fields.description: Any further taxonomic remarks.
